DataElement.preferredName: Patient Future Research Cancer Biobank Storage Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for information related to a patient's consent to provide specimen(s) for future research and storage in a Biobank.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Future Research Cancer Biobank Storage Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a patient's consent to provide specimen(s) for future research and storage in a Biobank.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Future Research Cancer Biobank Storage Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: A time that is yet to come.:systematic investigation to establish facts.:A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A time that is yet to come.

A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: My biopsy samples left over a
ReferenceDocuments.description: My biopsy samples left over after the main research study is done and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: My non-biopsy samples such as leftover blood samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.
